title: Greater Nashik Metro
text:
The Greater Nashik Metro or Metro NEO is a proposed rapid transit system in the <a href="Nashik%20Metropolitan%20Region">Nashik Metropolitan Region</a>. The system is proposed to reduce traffic congestion as well as provide direct connectivity to Nashik city from its suburbs. The Greater Nashik Metro will connect suburbs of Nashik city like <a href="Deolali">Deolali</a>, <a href="Nashik%20Road">Nashik Road</a>, Upnagar, <a href="Nashik%20Airport">Nashik Airport</a>, <a href="Sinnar">Sinnar</a>, <a href="Igatpuri">Igatpuri</a>, Gangapur Road, <a href="Trimbakeshwar%20tehsil">Trimbakeshwar</a>, <a href="Dindori%2C%20Maharashtra">Dindori</a>, <a href="Bhagur">Bhagur</a>, <a href="Niphad">Niphad</a>, <a href="Adgaon%20Khurd">Adgaon</a>, <a href="Ghoti%20Khurd">Ghoti</a> and Girnare.
This project is implemented and operated by <a href="Maharashtra%20Metro%20Rail%20Corporation%20Limited">Maharashtra Metro Rail Corporation Limited</a> with the help of Central and State Government, <a href="Nashik%20Metropolitan%20Region%20Development%20Authority">Nashik Metropolitan Region Development Authority</a> (NMRDA) and <a href="Nashik%20Municipal%20Corporation">Nashik Municipal Corporation</a>. It will be India's first <a href="Rubber-tyred%20metro">Rubber-tyred metro</a>. <a href="Maharashtra">Maharashtra</a> Chief Minister <a href="Uddhav%20Thackeray">Uddhav Thackeray</a> in an interview stated that feasibility report will be created soon. Greater Nashik Metro will be implemented by <a href="Maharashtra%20Metro%20Rail%20Corporation%20Limited">MahaMetro</a> and funded by <a href="City%20and%20Industrial%20Development%20Corporation">City and Industrial Development Corporation</a> (CIDCO).
Project details (DPR).
Budget
The Maharashtra government has invested 2,100.6 crore for the "Metro Neo" project.
1st line
The first line is proposed from Shramik nagar (Satpur) in west to <a href="Nasik%20Road%20railway%20station">Nasik Road railway station</a> in east.
There will be 17 stations on this route. The route will be of 22.5 km.
2nd line
This route is proposed to be built from Gangapur to Mumbai Naka.
There will be 10 stations on this route which will be 10.5 km long.
Depots
A tram (rubber tyred metro) depot will be constructed at Shramik nagar.
Interchange station
Interchange station will be constructed at CBS and Gangapur
